page.title: 14Billingham Folklore Festival
page.content: Every August Billingham is transformed for the Folklore Festival. Posters and flowering baskets appear and stands of seats are errected. The stage is built and microphones tested. Visitors wearing traditional costume go shopping. When the festival begins the stands fill up with people. All groups are present for the opening ceremony. They parade through the town centre playing music. This year (1985) the 21st festival was celebrated. The festival first started to attract people to the new shopping centre. Every year up to 14 groups are invited to take part. There are no competitions and groups come because they enjoy showing their dances. Groups have come from Poland, Italy, Hong-kong, China and South America. The festival lasts for 8 days.
